授業目的:
1. To introduce the main religions in present day Japan by examining their roots and historical developments.
2. To discuss cultural expressions of religious commitments, e.g. pilgrimage, architecture and art.
3. To polish the academic skills of the participants through assignments related to the course.
到達目標:
1. The participant can outline the history and ideas of the major religions in Japan.
2. The participant can discuss cultural phenomena related to religions.
3. The participant can produce an academic paper dealing with an aspect of the general topic.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
Link to simultaneous and two-way participation for those with permission: ID: 850 5296 1538 / Passcode: 336035
Face to face format, but also simultaneously online for students with permission. The class structure of this course will be: short lecture on the topic, class discussion and participation and summation on the issues. Students will be expected to have read the assigned materials prior to the class and prepare to respond to the questions raised in the class. Additionally, students will be expected to be ready for briefing articles and cases in the course materials and will be prepared to discuss on those articles and cases.
